weather_report:
As the day unfolds across Downtown San Francisco, a veil of clouds casts a muted tapestry over the skyline, whispering of rain to come. Currently, the atmosphere teeters on the brink of spritzes; a sprinkle may flirt with the city between the early afternoon hours, though the high of 62 will soon yield to cooler breezes as temperatures dip. The south winds, soft yet assertive, carry the scent of the sea, promising an evening where the clouds will surrender to the insistence of raindrops.

Tonight promises a shift—a symphony of showers and the occasional rumble of thunder. With rainfall expected to dance through until dawn, residents might brace for a cozy evening indoors. If out and about, thoughtful layering will serve well; a warm jacket paired with a trusty umbrella will safeguard against the encroaching wetness. It’s a time perfect for sinking into the comfort of a warm café, perhaps with a good book or lively conversation, as the rain serenades the city, tapping gently against windows. Embrace this quiet interlude, for even the cloudiest days hold their charm—an invitation to pause, reflect, and savor the simple pleasures of life in a vibrant, breathing cityscape.
